articles.headline: How Virus Politics Divided a Conservative Town in Wisconsin’s North
articles.snippet: A lightly populated area in the critical swing state of Wisconsin serves as a microcosm for the way coronavirus politics is worsening partisan schisms across America.
articles.abstract: A lightly populated area in the critical swing state of Wisconsin serves as a microcosm for the way coronavirus politics is worsening partisan schisms across America.
articles.lead_paragraph: MINOCQUA, Wis. — When coronavirus cases began to spike in Wisconsin this fall, Rob Swearingen kept his restaurant open and let customers and employees decide whether they wanted to wear masks.

articles.headline: For Retailers, a Halloween Shock: It’s Actually Happening
articles.snippet: Sales of costumes and decorations have been strong, with some seeing the holiday as a last hurrah before winter and the pandemic send people back inside.
articles.abstract: Sales of costumes and decorations have been strong, with some seeing the holiday as a last hurrah before winter and the pandemic send people back inside.
articles.lead_paragraph: Scott Morris, a co-owner of Morris Costumes in Charlotte, N.C., has slept at the office for the past 50 days — but he isn’t complaining.
articles.byline: By Sapna Maheshwari and Gillian Friedman

articles.headline: Economy’s Big Rebound Leaves a Shortfall as Progress Slows
articles.snippet: Third-quarter growth set a record, fueled by federal assistance. But recent signs point to a loss of momentum in job gains and production.
articles.abstract: Third-quarter growth set a record, fueled by federal assistance. But recent signs point to a loss of momentum in job gains and production.
articles.lead_paragraph: U.S. economic output increased at the fastest pace on record last quarter as businesses began to reopen and customers returned to stores. But the economy has climbed only partway out of its pandemic-induced hole, and progress is slowing.

articles.headline: Dan Bongino Has No Idea Why Facebook Loves Him
articles.snippet: The right-wing commentator, whose page performs better than those of major news organizations, is perplexed by his social media success.
articles.abstract: The right-wing commentator, whose page performs better than those of major news organizations, is perplexed by his social media success.
articles.lead_paragraph: Just a few years ago, Dan Bongino was a B-list pundit working on the fringes of conservative media.

articles.headline: Trump and Biden Converge in Florida, an Elusive Prize Still Up for Grabs
articles.snippet: The presidential rivals both appeared in Tampa, confronting their vulnerabilities and courting a range of voters, a clear sign that both see their political fortunes tied to the state.
articles.abstract: The presidential rivals both appeared in Tampa, confronting their vulnerabilities and courting a range of voters, a clear sign that both see their political fortunes tied to the state.
articles.lead_paragraph: TAMPA, Fla. — That old political heartbreaker, the presidential battleground of Florida, lured the two White House contenders to the same city on Thursday, as President Trump and Joseph R. Biden Jr. confronted some of their biggest political vulnerabilities in a state that is once again shaping up as the most elusive prize in next week’s election.
articles.byline: By Katie Glueck and Patricia Mazzei

articles.headline: 2016 Nonvoters, a Key Prize for Biden and Trump, Turn Out in Droves
articles.snippet: In Pennsylvania and other battlegrounds, both parties are succeeding in coaxing infrequent voters off the sidelines. The all-important question is who does it better.
articles.abstract: In Pennsylvania and other battlegrounds, both parties are succeeding in coaxing infrequent voters off the sidelines. The all-important question is who does it better.
articles.lead_paragraph: [Follow our live Trump vs Biden 2020 election updates and analysis.]

articles.headline: Tiffany Deal Is a Signature Move by the Sun Tzu of Luxury
articles.snippet: Bernard Arnault, the chairman of LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton and the richest man in Europe, is no stranger to public battles.
articles.abstract: Bernard Arnault, the chairman of LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton and the richest man in Europe, is no stranger to public battles.
articles.lead_paragraph: The soap opera also known as the largest deal in luxury, the LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton-Tiffany acquisition, finally has a happy ending.
articles.byline: By Vanessa Friedman and Elizabeth Paton

articles.headline: Egyptian Teen Seeks Justice in Rape Case, and a Battle Erupts Over Women’s Rights
articles.snippet: A generation of young women in Egypt who have found their voice on social media are challenging the old rules that blamed women when they were attacked by men.
articles.abstract: A generation of young women in Egypt who have found their voice on social media are challenging the old rules that blamed women when they were attacked by men.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAIRO — It was a party Aya Khamees has tried hard to forget.

articles.headline: How a Century of Real-Estate Tax Breaks Enriched Donald Trump
articles.snippet: The real estate industry has long enjoyed uniquely favorable tax treatment — thanks in part to Mr. Trump’s actions before and after he became president.
articles.abstract: The real estate industry has long enjoyed uniquely favorable tax treatment — thanks in part to Mr. Trump’s actions before and after he became president.

articles.byline: By Jesse Drucker and James B. Stewart
